snippet: A majority of 18- to 29-year-olds disapprove of the Affordable Care Act, and fewer than a third of those who are uninsured are likely to sign up for coverage, according to a new poll by Harvard University’s Institute of Politics.
abstract: A majority of 18- to 29-year-olds disapprove of the Affordable Care Act, and fewer than a third of those who are uninsured are likely to sign up for coverage, according to a new poll by Harvard University’s Institute of Politics.

headline.main: Poll Finds Young People Souring on Health Law and Obama
